noun.description: The faculty or power of using one's will.
examples: without conscious volition she backed into her office

phrases: they choose to leave early of their own volition
We recently had more than 200 pupils staying on after school to do sport of their own volition.
But most of them are going on their own volition.
What I don't like is that some truly great people have left the company, not of their own volition.
Eventually the offenders left of their own volition.
origin: Early 17th century (denoting a decision or choice made after deliberation): from French, or from medieval Latin volitio(n-), from volo I wish.
